snippet: Sales at General Motors rose 1 percent in June despite the crisis over faulty ignitions that has prompted lawsuits and huge product recalls, in large part because of rising Buick sales.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column observes that General Motors' Buick division has emerged as an unlikely asset for company as it reels from crisis over faulty ignitions; notes Buick sales surged 18 percent over previous year, enough to push GM's overall profits up 1 percent despite scandal; says company's decision to reinvent Buick as a maker of smaller, premium-priced vehicles has paid off.
lead_paragraph: Sales at General Motors rose 1 percent in June despite the crisis over faulty ignitions that has prompted lawsuits and huge product recalls, in large part because of rising Buick sales.
